title: Experiment with fusion silhouettes this Diwali
text: Planning your festive wardrobe can get exhausting and monotonous. While playing dress-up is fun, the idea of wearing heavy-duty lehengas and saris to each event can get taxing. Long nights of card parties, endless Diwali lunches and that office party you can’t miss – there’s a smart way of showing up to all these occasions without making it look repetitive.Ditch your traditional blouse for a crisp white shirt and pair it with a bright-coloured lehenga and a pair of statement earrings, a classic Karisma Kapoor move. Swap the voluminous skirt for a flared pair of palazzos, and team it with a cropped top, just like Sara Ali Khan did. Here’s our edit of all the unconventional ways in which you can spruce up your festive style.
description: Karisma Kapoor and Tapsee Pannu giving us lessons on how to work the fusion silhouettes trend this Diwali
